title: Clean and Unclean Animals
summary: Leviticus 11 outlines which animals are clean (permissible to eat) and unclean. The chapter categorizes land animals, sea creatures, birds, and insects, providing dietary boundaries for the Israelites.

faq.question: What animals were considered clean?
faq.answer: Animals that chew the cud and have split hooves (like cows and sheep) were clean.

faq.question: Why were these distinctions made?
faq.answer: To set Israel apart as a holy people who obey Godâ€™s commands and reflect His purity.
